title: David Haye FIT for Tony Bellew showdown after visiting specialist in Munich following late injury scare
text:
David Haye FIT for Tony Bellew showdown after visiting specialist in Munich following late injury scare The former heavyweight world champion flew to Germany on Tuesday afternoon Share David Haye poses with pal Joe Fournier and doctor Hans Wilhelm Muller-Wohlfahrt (Photo: Mirror.co.uk) Share Get daily     
David Haye WILL be fit to face Tony Bellew on Saturday despite an injury scare. 
The former heavyweight champion chartered a private jet to Munich yesterday to see German doctor Hans Wilhelm Muller-Wohlfahrt. 
The former Bayern Munich team doctor - who has also treated Usain Bolt - helped with Haye's rehabilitation in 2013 when he ruptured his shoulder. 
Haye flew to the German city with millionaire friend and fellow boxer Joe Fournier and is due back this afternoon. 
The 36-year-old will perform a public workout this evening along with Bellew before Thursday’s final press conference. Video Loading   David Haye in Munich just days before Bellew fight Share this video Haye headed to Germany on Tuesday afternoon (Photo: Pete Maclaine/i-Images) Haye travelled in style in a Rolls Royce (Photo: Pete Maclaine/i-Images) Haye was accompanied by friend and fellow boxer Fournier (Photo: Pete Maclaine/i-Images) Read More How the war of words between David Haye and Tony Bellew led to the biggest heavyweight fight of the year 
They will finally put weeks of trash talking behind them on Saturday night after a controversial build-up in which Haye has vowed to send his opponent to hospital. 
The Londoner spent the majority of his training camp in Miami where he enjoyed down time aboard a £27million yacht. 
He hopes victory over Bellew will propel him into a clash with world champion Anthony Joshua later this year. 
Joshua must first navigate former divisional ruler Wladimir Klitschko at Wembley on April 29. Haye will come face to face with Bellew on Thursday (Photo: i-Images Picture Agency) Mueller-Wohlfahrt has also treated Usain Bolt (Photo: Getty Images) 
Haye made his ring return last year after almost four years on sidelines. 
Facile victories over Mark de Mori and Arnold Gjergjaj followed before he found himself on Bellew's radar. 
The Liverpudlian holds a cruiserweight world title but will move up a division for the first time.
